name: pregy
description: Note that the information concerning year and month of birth from the “Mother & Child” and “Parent” questionnaires proved to be partially inconsistent. Therefore, as of the beginning of 2012 the child’s age in months is computed using birth information from ppfad. For further information, refer to the documentation on ppfad. Furthermore, this question is only asked in bioage01.
label: Mother: Pregnant When Had Personal Interview, year

name: pregmo
description: This variable is based on the exact month of birth (BCPREGMO), the duration of childbearing in weeks (BCSSW) and the interview month of the previous year’s personal interview. Hence this information is available only for those women in the sample for at least two years. As the exact day of birth is unknown, this variable remains a close approximation. Furthermore, this question is only asked in bioage01.
label: mother: month of pregnancy at individual interview

name: prebeg
description: The variable BCPREBEG contains information on the beginning of pregnancy (i.e., the month of conception). Information is given in the regular SOEP spell format: values start with 1 for January 1983 (e.g., the earliest spell in bioage01, survey year 2010, is 304, which equals April 2008). Furthermore, this question is only asked in bioage01.
label: Spell Start Pregnancy(Month,01.83=1)

name: preend
description: The variable is based on the exact month of birth (BCPREGMO) and the duration of pregnancy in weeks (BCSSW). Accordingly, information is available only for women who completed the “Mother & Child Questionnaire” and for whom the duration of the pregnancy is known. Note that the month of conception may vary by one month as the exact date of birth remains unknown. Furthermore, this question is only asked in bioage01.
label: spell end of pregnancy, birth

name: lb0013_h
description:
Step 1: The variable lb0013_h is replaced by the variable lb0013_v1 for the years 1999 to 2012. 
Step 2: The variable lb0013_h is replaced with lb0013_v2 for the years 2013 to 2020.
label: [de] Geburtsort [harmonisiert]

name: lb0016_h
description:
Step 1: The country codes expressed in variable lb0016_v1 are recoded for the years 1999 to 2012 according to ISO3n and subsequently integrated into the harmonized variable lb0016_h. 
Step 2: The country codes expressed in variable lb0016_v2 are recoded for the year 2013 according to ISO3n and subsequently integrated into the harmonized variable lb0016_h. 
Step 3: The country codes expressed in variable lb0016_v3 are recoded for the years 2014 to 2020 according to ISO3n and subsequently integrated into the harmonized variable lb0016_h. 
Step 4: The variable lb0016_h is replaced by the variable lb0016_v6 for the years 2022 to 2023.
label: [de] Code Geburtsland [harmonisiert]

name: lb1022_h
description:
Step 1: The variable lb1022_h is replaced by the variable lb1022_v1 for the years 1999 to 2020. 
Step 2: The variable lb1022_h is replaced by the variable lb1022_v2 for the years 2022 to 2023, if lb1022_v3 is not 1. 
Step 3: The variable lb1022_h is replaced by the variable lb1022_v3 for the years 2022 to 2023, if lb1022_v2 is not 1. 
Step 4: The variable lb1022_v4 is recoded (1=2) for the years 2022 and 2023 and subsequently integrated into the harmonized variable lb1022_h, if lb1022_v4 is 1. 
Step 5: The variable lb1022_h is replaced with 3 for the years 2022 to 2023, if lb1022_v3 is 1 and lb1022_v2 is 1.
label: [de] Zweitwohnung [harmonisiert]

name: pid
description: Same person identifier as in SOEP-IS data files
label: Person ID

name: subsample
description: During the study period, an older, outdated app version was distributed for a restricted time window due to a technical error (N = 72 with outdated version; N = 313 with correct version). This older app version differed slightly in some wordings of the daily diary items. Here, we present documentation for the correct app version that the majority of respondents installed. For more details on this matter and an extensive comparison of the two app versions, see OSF repository.
label: Subsample

name: n_days
description: Counts the number of days after installation starting with 1 at the day after installation where the first daily diary was available to be answered. In contrast to n_diary, this variable takes into account when respondents fill out a questionnaire the following day or have gaps when they skipped a questionnaire.
label: Study Day Count

name: n_call
description: Counts the number of calls per person and per study day starting at 1.
label: Call Count ID

name: n_diary
description: Counts the number of answered daily diaries starting at 1.
label: Questionnaire Count

name: trig_valence
description: The answers is given on a 7-point Likert scale from 1 to 7, with anchors "unpleasant" and "pleasant".
label: Valence of Call

name: pid
description: Same person identifier as in SOEP-IS data files
label: Person ID

name: subsample
description: During the study period, an older, outdated app version was distributed for a restricted time window due to a technical error (N = 72 with outdated version; N = 313 with correct version). This older app version differed slightly in some wordings of the daily diary items. Here, we present documentation for the correct app version that the majority of respondents installed. For more details on this matter and an extensive comparison of the two app versions, see OSF repository.
label: Subsample

name: ep_start
description: Marks the beginning of the episode on each day across which all the mobile sensing variables are aggregated.
label: Start of Episode

name: ep_end
description: Marks the end of the episode on each day across which all the mobile sensing variables are aggregated. In some case, when the daily diary was answered after midnight, this time point is on the following day from "ep_start".
label: End of Episode

name: ep_dur
description: Time between "ep_start" and "ep_end" given in minutes. This is the length of time across which all mobile sensing variables were aggregated on that day.
label: Duration of Episode

name: n_diary
description: Counts the number of answered daily diaries starting at 1.
label: Questionnaire Count

name: n_days
description: Counts the number of days after installation starting with 1 at the day after installation where the first daily diary was available to be answered. In contrast to n_diary, this variable takes into account when respondents fill out a questionnaire the following day or have gaps when they skipped a questionnaire. Negative values indicate days before a person answered their first daily diary.
label: Study Day Count

name: frie_dur_sub
description:
Now it's about your friends:
How much personal contact did you have today?

Answers are given on a 7-point Likert-scale from 1 to 7, with anchors „very little“ and „very much“;
Alternative response: „Did not have contact with friends“ leads directly to next question on colleagues.
label: Friends: Duration Rating

name: frie_dur_obj
description:
Now it's about your friends:
How long was your personal contact today?

The answer is given on a scroll wheel: „0h:05min“, „0h:15min“, „0h:30min“, „1h:00min“, „1h:30min“, … (in 30min increments until…), „24h:00min“.
label: Friends: Duration in Hours

name: frie_val
description:
Now it's about your friends:
How was the contact?

Answers are given on a 7-point Likert-scale from 1 to 7, with anchors „unpleasant“ and „pleasant“.
label: Friends: Valence

name: coll_dur_sub
description:
Now it's about your colleagues:
How much personal contact did you have today?

Answers are given on a 7-point Likert-scale from 1 to 7, with anchors „very little“ and „very much“;
Alternative response: „Did not have contact with colleagues“ leads directly to next question on partner.
label: Colleagues: Duration Rating

name: coll_dur_obj
description:
Now it's about your colleagues:
How long was your personal contact today?

The answer is given on a scroll wheel: „0h:05min“, „0h:15min“, „0h:30min“, „1h:00min“, „1h:30min“, … (in 30min increments until…), „24h:00min“.
label: Colleagues: Duration in Hours

name: coll_val
description:
Now it's about your colleagues:
How was the contact?

Answers are given on a 7-point Likert-scale from 1 to 7, with anchors „unpleasant“ and „pleasant“.
label: Colleagues: Valence

name: prop_voice
description: This variable is computed by dividing n_voice by n_aware.
label: Proportion of Conversations

name: pid
description: Same person identifier as in SOEP-IS data files.
label: Person ID

name: subsample
description: During the study period, an older, outdated app version was distributed for a restricted time window due to a technical error (N = 72 with outdated version; N = 313 with correct version). This older app version differed slightly in some wordings of the daily diary items. Here, we present documentation for the correct app version that the majority of respondents installed. For more details on this matter and an extensive comparison of the two app versions, see OSF repository.
label: Subsample

name: n_days
description: Counts the number of days after installation starting with 1 at the day after installation where the first daily diary was available to be answered. In contrast to n_diary, this variable takes into account when respondents fill out a questionnaire the following day or have gaps when they skipped a questionnaire. Negative values indicate days before a person answered their first daily diary.
label: Study Day Count

name: n_hour
description: Counts the hours over which data are aggregated per person and per study day going from 0 to 23.
label: Hour of the day

name: prop_voice
description: This variable is computed by dividing n_voice by n_aware.
label: Proportion of Conversations

name: hgmoveyr
description:
For old households at their old address, data is carried forward for up to two waves. For new households in SOEP and for old households that have moved, the variable is based on newly collected data. In case the information is missing and an old household has moved that year or the previous year, HGMOVEYR is given the value of the year of the respective wave.

 The carrying forward of data entails the possibility that the year of moving into the new dwelling may lie before the year of birth of the oldest household member.
label: Year Moved Into Dwelling

name: hgcnstyr
description: Classified statement of the year the building in which a household lives at the time of the survey was built.

description:

name: hgowner
description: In all waves, codes 1 and 4 are used if the original variable is coded as -1 (“no answer”) but if at least one answer that is specific to owners, respectively to tenants, was given. Code 4 is also used if a change in ownership (from owner to tenant) has taken place, but no original information for HGOWNER was given.
label: Tenant Or Owner Of Dwelling

name: hgacquis
description:
Statement by respondent (household head). If no new information is provided and a change of address or ownership status (HGOWNER) has not taken place, the information of the previous year is carried forward.

This information is not assessed in the Questionnaire of the SOEP Innovation Sample from 2012 on, therefore this variable is not generated for these years and coded to \"-5\" (not contained in questionnaire).
label: Means Of Acquiring Dwelling

name: hgsubsid
description: Statement by respondent. HGSUBSID contains information on government subsidies at the time the housing was built or bought. Information is carried forward until the year 1999.
label: Government Subsidizes Housing Payments

name: hgosubs
description:
Statement by respondent. HGOSUBS contains information on cash housing subsidies received from the government during the year prior to the interview. Information is not carried forward.

This information is not assessed in the Questionnaire of the SOEP Innovation Sample from 2012 on, therefore this variable is not generated for these years and coded to \"-5\" (not contained in questionnaire).
label: Amount Of Subsidies Last Year
label_de: Förderung mit öff. Darlehen letztes Jahr

name: hgreval
description:
Subjective assessment by respondent (household head). The corresponding information from the previous year is not carried forward longitudinally due to the possibility of changes in rent and income, residential moves, and change in the person responding.

This information is not assessed in the Questionnaire of the SOEP Innovation Sample from 2012 on, therefore this variable is not generated for these years and coded to \"-5\" (not contained in questionnaire).
label: Rent Of Dwelling Vs Comparable Dwellings

name: hgrsubs
description: This information is not assessed in the Questionnaire of the SOEP Innovation Sample from 2012 on, therefore this variable is not generated for these years and coded to \"-5\" (not contained in questionnaire).

name: hgreduc
description:
Information is carried forward from the previous years for
 old households residing at their old address; for new
 households and for old households that have moved, newly
 collected data is used.

This information is not assessed in the Questionnaire of the SOEP Innovation Sample from 2012 on, therefore this variable is not generated for these years and coded to \"-5\" (not contained in questionnaire).
label: Dwelling At A Reduced Prize

name: hgsize
description:
In the following cases the information on HGSIZE is still missing:

- The information could not be carried forward (e.g. due to the household moving)

- A new household did not provide information

- The size of the housing unit changed, but no new information was provided

- The given value was found to be implausible.

Missing cases in 2009 and 2010 were imputed using a regression model with the following independent variables:  

- Number of rooms larger than 6 square meters (see variable HGROOM)

- Size of the household (HHGR)

- Status of ownership (HGOWNER)

- Year house was constructed (HGCNSTYR)

- Type of building (WUM1)

- Adequacy of living space in housing unit (HGSEVAL)

- SOEP Subsample (HSAMPLE)

- Dummy variable coded “1” for households living in Eastern Germany

 The results of these imputations are also carried forward for up to two waves unless new information is provided in later waves.

In case HGSIZE is imputed, the flag variable HGFSIZE takes the value “1”.

The number of missing cases from 2011 on was reduced by carrying on the information from previous years, unless there was a relocation of the household. Note the possibility of a change in the size of the housing unit even when no relocation happened. We estimate that there was a (undetected) change in size of the housing unit for around 3% of the households that did not relocate.
label: Size of Housing Unit in Square Meters

name: hgroom
description:
The procedure of carrying forward and imputation is identical to that for HGSIZE. In the regression model the same covariates are used with the exception of HGROOM which is replaced with HGSIZE (size of the housing unit in square meters). In case information on HGSIZE is missing, a first imputation was done excluding HGSIZE. In case information for HGSIZE exists, these values were replaced with values obtained from a second imputation including HGSIZE as a covariate.   

In case HGROOM is imputed, the flag variable HGFROOM takes the value “1”.

This information is not assessed in the Questionnaire of the SOEP Innovation Sample from 2012 on, therefore this variable is not generated for these years and coded to \"-5\" (not contained in questionnaire).
label: Number Of Rooms Larger than 6 Square Meters

name: hgheat
description: This information is not assessed in the Questionnaire of the SOEP Innovation Sample from 2012 on, therefore this variable is not generated for these years and coded to \"-5\" (not contained in questionnaire).
label: Costs Of Warm Water (gen)

name: hgutil
description:
HGRENT, HGUTIL and HGHEAT are generated variables on the housing cost of households in rental properties. HGRENT is a measure of the gross rent including utility costs (HGUTIL) and excluding heating costs (HGHEAT).

For further  information on HGRENT, HGUTIL and HGHEAT please see the corresponding SOEP HGEN documentation.
label: Cost Allocation (gen)

name: hgrent
description:
Because detailed information on heating costs is not assessed
 in the Questionnaire of the SOEP Innovation Sample, in the
 years 2011 and 2012 HGRENT was generated by simply duplicating
 respondents’ answers on the amount of monthly rent from the H
 dataset.
label: Amount of Rent Minus Heating Costs (EUR)

name: hgelectr
description:
Information was collected in wave BA (2010) for the first time. The procedure of imputation is identical to that for HGHEAT. In the regression model the same covariates are used.
 
In case HGELECTR is imputed, the flag variable HGFELECTR takes the value “1”. In the year 2011, no imputation of HGELECTR was conducted.

This information is not assessed in the Questionnaire of the SOEP Innovation Sample from 2012 on, therefore this variable is not generated for these years and coded to \"-5\" (not contained in questionnaire).
label: Costs of Electricity (gen)

name: hgnorent
description:
Coded as “1” if the household does not pay rent; e.g., if living space is provided by relatives at no cost. Note that in these cases, the information on gross cold rent (HGRENT), heating costs (HGHEAT) and utilities (HGUTIL) is coded “-2” (“not applicable”).

 Information is not carried forward.
label: Does Not Pay Rent

name: hgfsize
description: This variable contains information, whether the refering variable has been imputed. If the refering information has not been assessed in the questionnaire, this flag also contains \"-5\" (not contained in questionnaire).
label: Imputation Flag, Size Of Housing

name: hgfroom
description: This variable contains information, whether the refering variable has been imputed. If the refering information has not been assessed in the questionnaire, this flag also contains \"-5\" (not contained in questionnaire).
label: Imputation Flag, Number Of Rooms Lager than 6 Square Meters
label_de: Imputation Flag, Zahl der Wohnräume über 6 qm

name: hgfheat
description: This variable contains information, whether the refering variable has been imputed. If the refering information has not been assessed in the questionnaire, this flag also contains \"-5\" (not contained in questionnaire).
label: Imputation Flag, Costs Of Heating And Warm Water

name: hgfutil
description:
Please note that HGFUTIL is also given the value “1” for households reporting that utility costs are only partly included in the amount of rent stated (see the description of HGUTIL).

This variable contains information, whether the refering variable has been imputed. If the refering information has not been assessed in the questionnaire, this flag also contains \"-5\" (not contained in questionnaire).
label: Imputation Flag, Cost Allocation

name: hgfrent
description:
HGFRENT indicates that at least one of the components of HGRENT (HGUTIL or HGHEAT) or HGRENT itself is imputed. It is only given positive values if the respective imputed component is part of HGRENT.

“1”: The household did not provide information on the amount of HGRENT, thus the basic value of HGRENT is imputed.

“2”: Utility costs are imputed and had to be added to the amount of rent stated to obtain the target measure of gross HGRENT.

“3”: Heating costs are imputed and had to be deducted from the amount of rent stated to obtain the target measure of gross HGRENT excluding heating costs.

This variable contains information, whether the refering variable has been imputed. If the refering information has not been assessed in the questionnaire, this flag also contains \"-5\" (not contained in questionnaire).
label: Imputation Flag, Amount Of Rent Minus Heating Costs

name: hgfelectr
description: This variable contains information, whether the refering variable has been imputed. If the refering information has not been assessed in the questionnaire, this flag also contains \"-5\" (not contained in questionnaire).
label: Imputation Flag, Costs of Electricity

name: hgtyp1hh
description:
Generated variable created by combining the relationships of all persons living in the household to the head of household (Variable $STELL in the file PBRUTTO) at the time of the survey.

From 2009 onwards, the data production process switched to a standardized procedure for all waves to ensure longitudinal consistency, resulting in minor changes compared with older distributions.

HGTYP1HH is an aggregation of HGTYP2HH (first column of the two-digit code). Single households are differentiated in HGTYP2HH according to both gender and age.

Due to a slightly modified $STELL variable in the file PBRUTTO, the generation syntax of HGTYP1HH and HGTYP2HH needed to be updated in the year 2011.

 Legend:  

• LE = less or equal

• GT = greater than

• K = child
label: Household Typology, One Digit

name: hghmonth
description: The month of participation in the survey is generated using data from the household questionnaire.
label: Month Of Interview

name: hghmode
description: The interview method is generated through data from the household questionnaire.
label: Interview Method

name: hghinc
description: This variable contains the current monthly net household income asked for in the household questionnaire, always provided in euros. Income is reported by the respondent (head of household).
label: Monthly Household Net Income (EUR)

name: hgahinc
description:
This variable is based on the current monthly net household income asked for directly in the household questionnaire (“screener”). Since everyone in SOEP over the age of 16 is also interviewed personally, this income can be calculated based on the current individual monthly incomes of all household members. Possible underestimation in “screener” can thus be assessed and corrected. However, in the case of item-nonresponse on the original screener, the procedure is only used for households surveyed completely, without item-non-response on the variables in question.

For personal income, we use monthly net income (from dependent employment and self-employment), extra earnings, pensions, widow’s pensions, unemployment benefits or relief, maintenance payments, early retirement payments, maternity benefits, BaFoeG (state higher education grants), military or civil service pay, compulsory child support, as well as other forms of support from the P files.
Civil servants’ pensions income is taxed at the flat rate of 20% and multiple entries on the use of employment office services are corrected for by calculating a median value.
We add all the individual incomes of all interviewed household members, also adding to this sum all income from the household context (housing subsidies, child benefits, welfare and home nursing subsidies, social assistance; since 2005 also Unemployment Benefit II (“ALG II”) or Social Benefit).

When no answer was provided on net household income, we use the net household income calculated as described above, under the condition that all household members gave valid answers.
If the net household income generated in this way is higher than the household income stated in the questionnaire, we correct the value upwards. When no answer was given for the different components of income, we set the value of the particular component at zero.
HGAHINC was not generated from 2011 on.
label: Adjusted Monthly Household Net Income (EUR)

name: hgnuts1
description: NUTS (\"Nomenclature of Statistical Territorial Units\") is a hierarchical system for dividing up the economic territory of the European Union. It was introduced by Eurostat more than 30 years ago in order to provide a single uniform breakdown of territorial units for the production of regional statistics. NUTS 1 especially contains the major socio-economic regions for analyzing regional Community problems. It subdivides the European Union by now into 97 regions, whereas in Germany there are equivalent to the German Federal States 16 regions.
label: NUTS-Systematic-1 (Federal State)

name: hlc0006_h
description:
Step 1: The variable hlc0006_h is replaced by the variable hlc0006_v1 for the years 1999 to 2000. 
Step 2: The variable hlc0006_v2 is recoded (12=21) (13=31) (14=41) (15=51) for the years 2001 to 2002 and subsequently integrated into the harmonized variable hlc0006_h. 
Step 3: The variable hlc0006_h is replaced by the variable hlc0006_v3 for the years 2003 to 2020. 
Step 4: The variable hlc0006_h is replaced with 1 for the year 2022, if hlc0006_v5 is 1. 
Step 5: The variable hlc0006_h is replaced with 2 for the year 2022, if hlc0006_v5 is 2. 
Step 6: The variable hlc0006_h is replaced with 3 for the year 2022, if hlc0006_v6 is 1. 
Step 7: The variable hlc0006_h is replaced with 4 for the year 2022, if hlc0006_v6 is 2 and hlc0006_v7 is 1. 
Step 8: The variable hlc0006_h is replaced with 5 for the year 2022, if hlc0006_v6 is 2 and hlc0006_v7 is 2 and hlc0006_v8 is 1. 
Step 9: The variable hlc0006_h is replaced with 6 for the year 2022, if hlc0006_v6 is 2 and hlc0006_v7 is 2 and hlc0006_v8 is 2. 
Step 10: The variable hlc0006_h is replaced with 21 for the year 2022, if hlc0006_v4 is 1 and hlc0006_v5 is -1. 
Step 11: The variable hlc0006_h is replaced with 31 for the year 2022, if hlc0006_v4 is 2 and hlc0006_v6 is -1. 
Step 12: The variable hlc0006_h is replaced with 41 for the year 2022, if hlc0006_v6 is 2 and hlc0006_v7 is -1. 
Step 13: The variable hlc0006_h is replaced with 51 for the year 2022, if hlc0006_v6 is 2 and hlc0006_v7 is 2 and hlc0006_v8 is -1. 
Step 14: The variable hlc0006_h is replaced with -2 for the year 2022, if hlc0006_v4 does not apply to the person asked and hlc0006_v5 does not apply to the person asked and hlc0006_v6 does not apply to the person asked and hlc0006_v7 does not apply to the person asked and hlc0006_v8 does not apply to the person asked. 
Step 15: The variable hlc0006_h is replaced with -5 for the year 2022, if hlc0006_v4 is not included in that version of the questionnaire and hlc0006_v5 is not included in that version of the questionnaire and hlc0006_v6 is not included in that version of the questionnaire and hlc0006_v7 is not included in that version of the questionnaire and hlc0006_v8 is not included in that version of the questionnaire. 
Step 16: The variable hlc0006_h is replaced with -1 for the year 2022, if hlc0006_v4 is -1.
label: [de] HH-Nettoeinkommensgruppen [harmonisiert]

name: hlc0120_h
description:
Step 1: The variable hlc0120_v1 is converted into Euro by divisor 1.95583 (not adjusted for inflation) for the years 1998 to 2001 and subsequently integrated into the harmonized variable hlc0120_h. 
Step 2: The variable hlc0120_h is replaced by the variable hlc0120_v2 for the years 2002 to 2014 and 2022 to 2023. 
Step 3: The variable hlc0120_h is replaced with 0 for the years 2015 to 2020, if hlc0120_v3 does not apply to the person asked and hlc0120_v4 does not apply to the person asked. 
Step 4: The variable hlc0120_h is replaced with -5 for the years 2015 to 2020, if hlc0120_v3 is not included in that version of the questionnaire and hlc0120_v4 is not included in that version of the questionnaire. 
Step 5: The variable hlc0120_h is replaced with -3 for the years 2015 to 2020, if hlc0120_v3 is -3 or hlc0120_v4 is -3. 
Step 6: The variable hlc0120_h is replaced with -1 for the years 2015 to 2020, if hlc0120_v3 is -1 and hlc0120_v4 is -1. 
Step 7: The variable hlc0120_h is replaced by the variable hlc0120_v4 for the years 2015 to 2020, if the variables -1, -2 are 0 and hlc0120_v4 applies to the person asked. 
Step 8: The variable hlc0120_h is replaced by the variable hlc0120_v3 for the years 2015 to 2020, if the variables -1, -2 are 0 and hlc0120_v3 applies to the person asked. 
Step 9: The variable hlc0120_h is replaced with hlc0120_v3+hlc0120_v4 for the years 2015 to 2020, if hlc0120_v3 is greater than 0  and  hlc0120_v4 is greater than 0.

Step 2: The variable hlc0119_h is replaced by the variable hlc0119_v2 for the years 2015 to 2020. 
Step 3: The variable hlc0119_h is replaced by the variable hlc0119_v3 for the years 2015 to 2020, if hlc0119_v3 is 1. 
Step 4: The variable hlc0119_h is replaced by the variable hlc0119_v4 for the years 2015 to 2020, if hlc0119_v4 is 1.

name: cid
description: Case Id - Household Source Identifier (fixed). The fixed household source id point to the first SOEP ancestor households to which current households can be traced back to. This variable is relevant for sampling information and calculating the weights.
label: Original Houshold Number, Case ID

name: hid
description: The members and configuration of a household with a given ID (HID) can change between years. Depending on the respective research issue it may be necessary to check alterations using PPATHL, where persons are assigned to a household in each year.
label: Current Wave HH Number

name: syear
description: Survey year (Reference Year for survey instruments)
label: Survey Year

name: hnetto
description:
Wave-specific survey status: for HNETTO=1 there is a HH
interview in the respective year, i.e. an entry in the file
HL. For HNETTO=2 there is only an entry in the file
HBRUTTO, but the HH could not be interviewed (the reason for
which is given by the variable HERGS in the file HBRUTTO).HNETTO=3 indicates unrealized Households of new samples in HBRUTT-Files.
label: Aktueller Befragungsstatus

name: sampreg
description:
The variable SAMPREG tells whether a HH was
located in West or East Germany in the respective year. This variable approximates also former regional differences within Berlin according to zip-codes.
label: Aktuelle Stichprobenregion

name: hpop
description: POP was derived from WUM2 in HBRUTTO as well as PNAT_V* and STELL_V* (nationality and relationship to head of household in PBRUTTO). Missing values were imputed based on the person’s history. Thus, the only admissible missing value is –2, meaning not applicable.  This variable is therefore particularly important, as it enters into the determination of cross-sectional weights. The variable corresponds with POP in PPATH/L.
label: Aktuelle Populationszugehoerigkeit

name: hbleib
description: inverse probability weights
label: Inverse Staying Probability

name: hhrf
description: standard household weight. The weighting for the 2023 survey year is based on the previous year's marginal distribution. The updated marginal distributions of the Federal Statistical Office of Germany for 2023 were not yet available to us at the time of the data release. We therefore ask you to apply the weighting for 2023 with caution. The newly drawn sample in 2023 had to be integrated into the weighting with the information on the marginal distributions of the previous year, which can lead to additional inaccuracies.
label: PRELIMINARY: Weighting factor

name: aut01
label: Society should deal with misfits and slackers ruthlessly
label_de: Gegen Aussenseiter und Nichtstuer mit aller Haerte vorgehen

name: aut02
label: Troublemakers should feel unwelcome in society
label_de: Unruhestifter sollten spueren, dass sie in Gesellschaft unerwuenscht

name: aut03
label: Societal rules should be enforced ruthlessly

name: aut04
label: We need strong leadership figures to live safely

name: aut05
label: Important decisions should be made by leaders

name: aut06
label: We should be thankful for leadership figures

name: aut08
label: Proven habits should not be questioned
label_de: Bewaehrte Verhaltensweisen nicht in Frage stellen

name: aut09
label: Always the best to do things the usual way
label_de: Am Beste, Dinge in der ueblichen Art machen

name: bipaus01
label: A child who is not yet in school is likely to suffer from w
label_de: Ein Kind, das noch nicht zur Schule geht, wird wahrscheinlich darunter leiden, wenn seine Mutter berufstätig ist.

name: bipaus02
label: All in all, family life suffers when a woman works full time.
label_de: Alles in allem: Das Familienleben leidet darunter, wenn die Frau voll berufstätitig ist.

name: bipaus03
label: Having a job is all well and good, but what most women really want to do is work.
label_de: Einen Beruf zu haben ist ja ganz schön, aber das, was die meisten Frauen wirklich wollen, sind Heim und Kinder.

name: bipaus04
label: The husband and wife should both contribute to the household income
label_de: Der Mann und die Frau sollten beide zum Haushaltseinkommen beitragen

name: bipaus05
label: The man's job is to earn money, the woman's job is to take care of the household.
label_de: Die Aufgabe des Mannes ist es, Geld zu verdienen, die der Frau, sich um Haushalt und Familie zu kümmern.

name: bipbaus1
label: Statements - If someone does me a favor, I am ready to return it
label_de: Aussagen - Wenn mir jemanden einen Gefallen tut, bin ich bereit ihn zu erwidern

name: bipbaus2
label: Statements - If I am treated very unfairly, I take revenge on the first one
label_de: Aussagen – Wenn ich sehr ungerecht behandelt werde, räche ich mich bei der ersten Gelegenheit, selbst wenn Kosten entstehen, um das zu tun.

name: bipbaus3
label: Statements - I suspect that people have only the best intentions
label_de: Aussagen - Ich vermute, dass Leute nur die besten Absichten haben

name: bipbaus4
label: Statements - I tend to put off tasks even when I know it would be better to do them right away.
label_de: Aussagen - Ich neige dazu, Aufgaben zu verschieben, auch wenn ich weiß, dass es besser wäre sie gleich zu tun.

name: bipdikt
label: Result distribution game without value labels

label: How much larger is the left circle area compared to the right circle area
label_de: Wie viel größer ist die linke Kreisfläche im Vergleich zur rechten Kreisfläche

name: bipkvgl2
label: How much darker is the left circle area compared to the right circle area
label_de: Wie viel dunkler ist die linke Kreisfläche im Vergleich zur rechten Kreisfläche

label_de: Inwiefern trifft Beschreibung 1 auf Sie zu? Fällt es Ihnen eher schwer, Ihre Aus

name: bipugeld2
label: To what extent does description 2 apply to you? Do you find it rather difficult to spend money?
label_de: Inwiefern trifft Beschreibung 2 auf Sie zu? Fällt es Ihnen eher schwer, Geld aus

name: biss01
label: Set goal, but later pursue another one
label_de: Setze mir Ziel, aber verfolge spaeter doch ein anderes

name: biss02
label: For a short time obsessed with project or idea
label_de: Fuer kurze Zeit von Projekt oder Idee besessen

name: biss03
label: I have trouble staying focused on projects when they involve multiple
label_de: Ich habe Schwierigkeiten auf Projekte fokussiert zu bleiben, wenn diese mehrere

name: biss04
label: I tend to complete everything I start
label_de: Alles was ich beginne, bringe ich auch zu Ende

name: biss05
label: I am not discouraged by setbacks
label_de: Von Rueckschlaegen lasse ich mich nicht entmutigen

name: biss07
label: I am a hardworking person
label_de: Ich bin ein hart arbeitender Mensch

name: biss20
label: New ideas and projects keep me from completing old ones
label_de: Neue Ideen und Projekte halten mich manchmal von vorherigen ab

name: ieigaita5
label: Willing to do without today in order to benefit in the future
label_de: Bereit heute zu verzichten, um in Zukunft davon zu profitieren

name: mind01
label: Certain degree of intelligence that is not really changeable
label_de: Man hat ein bestimmtes Maß an Intelligenz, an dem man nicht wirklich viel ändern

name: mind02
label: You cannot change intelligence
label_de: Intelligenz ist etwas, das man nicht ändern kann

name: mind03
label: To be honest, you cannot really change how intelligent you are
label_de: Um ehrlich zu sein, man kann nicht wirklich ändern, wie intelligent man ist

name: mind04
label: You can learns new things but you cannot change your basic intelligence
label_de: Man kann neue Dinge lernen, aber nicht seine Grundintelligenz ändern

name: paut01
label: Outsiders and non-performers should be dealt with severely in society
label_de: Gegen Außenseiter und Nichtstuer sollte in der Gesellschaft mit aller Härte vorgegangen werden

name: paut02
label: Troublemakers should be made to feel clearly that they are unwanted in society
label_de: Unruhestifter sollten deutlich zu spüren bekommen, dass sie in der Gesellschaft unerwünscht sind

name: paut03
label: Social rules should be enforced without compassion
label_de: Gesellschaftliche Regeln sollten ohne Mitleid durchgesetzt werden

name: paut04
label: We need strong leaders to live safely in society
label_de: Wir brauchen starke Führungspersonen damit wir in der Gesellschaft sicher leben können

name: paut05
label: People should practice important decisions in society leaders
label_de: Menschen sollten wichtige Entscheidungen in der Gesellschaft Führungspersonen überlassen

name: paut06
label: We should be grateful for leaders who tell us exactly what to do kö
label_de: Wir sollten dankbar sein für führende Köpfe, die uns genau sagen, was wir tun kö

name: paut07
label: Traditions should be cherished and upheld at all costs
label_de: Traditionen sollten unbedingt gepflegt und aufrechterhalten werden

name: paut08
label: Proven behaviors should not be questioned
label_de: Bewährte Verhaltensweisen sollten nicht in Frage gestellt werden

name: paut09
label: It is always best to do things the usual way
label_de: Es ist immer das Beste, Dinge in der üblichen Art und Weise zu machen

name: pbipauss01
label: Compassion for those who suffer is the most important virtue
label_de: Mitgefühl für die, die leiden, ist die wichtigste Tugend

name: pbipauss02
label: When the government makes laws, they should always be such that everyone is treated fairly.
label_de: Wenn die Regierung Gesetze erlässt, sollten diese immer so sein, dass jeder fair behandelt wird.

name: pbipauss03
label: I am proud of the history of my country
label_de: Ich bin stolz auf die Geschichte meines Landes

name: pbipauss04
label: All children should learn respect for authority
label_de: Alle Kinder sollten Respekt gegenüber Autoritäten lernen

name: pbipauss05
label: People should not do things that are disgusting, even if no one is disturbed or hurt in the process.
label_de: Menschen sollten keine Dinge tun, die eklig sind, auch wenn keiner dabei gestört oder verletzt wird.

name: pbipauss06
label: It is better to do good things than bad things
label_de: Es ist besser gute Dinge zu tun, als schlechte

name: pbipauss07
label: Hurting a defenseless animal is one of the worst things a person can do.
label_de: Ein wehrloses Tier zu verletzten ist eines der schlimmsten Dinge, die ein Mensch tun kann.

name: pbipauss08
label: Justice is the most important cornerstone for a society
label_de: Gerechtigkeit ist der wichtigste Grundstein für eine Gesellschaft

name: pbipauss09
label: People should be loyal to their family members even if they have done something wrong.
label_de: Menschen sollten ihren Familienmitgliedern gegenüber loyal sein, auch wenn sie etwas Falsches getan haben.

name: pbipauss10
label: Men and women take on different roles in society
label_de: Männer und Frauen nehmen in der Gesellschaft verschiedene Rollen ein

name: pbipauss11
label: I would find certain acts wrong because they are unnatural
label_de: Ich würde bestimmte Taten falsch finden, weil sie unnatürlich sind

name: pbipbrstd
label: In the course of the Corona crisis, the scope of your actual working hours changed.
label_de: Im Zuge der Corona-Krise Umfang Ihrer tatsächl. Arbeitsstd. verändert

name: pbipcovjob1
label: Employed and not self-employed - Corona crisis Changes work situation: I worked short time
label_de: Erwerbstätig und nicht selbständig - Corona-Krise Änderungen Arbeitssituation: Ich arbeitete in Kurzarbeit

name: pbipcovjob2
label: Employed and not self-employed - Corona crisis changes work situation: I worked entirely in the home office
label_de: Erwerbstätig und nicht selbständig - Corona-Krise Änderungen Arbeitssituation: Ich arbeitete vollständig im Home Office

name: pbipcovjob3
label: Employed and not self-employed - Corona crisis Changes work situation: I worked partly in a home office
label_de: Erwerbstätig und nicht selbständig - Corona-Krise Änderungen Arbeitssituation: Ich arbeitete teilweise im Home Office

name: spa1
label: If someone does me a favor, I am ready to do him a favor too.
label_de: Wenn mir jemand einen Gefallen tut, bin ich bereit, ihm auch einen Gefallen zu t

name: spa2
label: If I am wronged badly, I will do my best to help the next person.
label_de: Wenn mir ein schweres Unrecht zuteil wird, werde ich mich um jeden Preis bei näc

name: spa3
label: If someone puts me in a difficult position, I will do the same to him m
label_de: Wenn mich jemand in eine schwierige Lage bringt, werde ich das Gleiche mit ihm m

name: spa4
label: I will make a special effort to help someone who has previously given me g
label_de: Ich strenge mich besonders an, um jemandem zu helfen, der mir früher schon mal g

name: spa5
label: If someone insults me, I will behave in an insulting manner towards them.
label_de: Wenn mich jemand beleidigt, werde ich mich ihm gegenüber auch beleidigend verhal

name: spa6
label: I am willing to spend time to help someone who has offended me in the past.
label_de: Ich bin bereit, Zeit damit zu verbringen, um jemandem zu helfen, der mir früher

name: spa7
label: When I am in an unfamiliar environment, I often feel unsafe
label_de: Wenn ich in einer ungewohnten Umgebung bin, fühle ich mich häufig unsicher

name: spa8
label: When I have a difficult task I am confident that I can do it well
label_de: Wenn ich eine schwierige Aufgabe habe bin ich sicher, dass ich sie gut meistern

name: spa9
label: I am someone who thinks of him/herself as capable
label_de: Ich bin jemand, der sich etwas zutraut

name: spa10
label: I believe that I will achieve much in my life
label_de: Ich glaube, dass ich im Leben viel erreichen werde

name: spa11
label: I believe that one day I will have a good and interesting job
label_de: Ich glaube, dass ich einmal einen guten und interessanten Beruf haben werde

name: spa12
label: I believe that I will earn a lot of money someday
label_de: Ich glaube, dass ich einmal viel Geld verdienen werde

name: spa13
label: If something can go either well or badly, I tend to believe beforehand that
label_de: Wenn etwas entweder gut oder schlecht laufen kann, glaube ich vorher eher, dass

name: spa14
label: I believe that, on the whole, good things are more likely to happen to me than bad things
label_de: Ich glaube, dass mir im Großen und Ganzen eher gute als schlechte Dinge passiere

name: spa15
label: If something can go wrong for me personally, I also believe that it will go wrong.
label_de: Wenn etwas für mich persönlich schief gehen kann, glaube ich auch, dass es schie

name: spa16
label: I believe you can be good at school in any subject by studying a lot.
label_de: Ich glaube, man kann durch ganz viel Lernen in jedem Fach in der Schule gut sein

name: spa17
label: What you achieve in life is primarily a matter of fate or luck
label_de: Was man im Leben erreicht, ist in erster Linie eine Frage von Schicksal oder Glü

name: spa18
label: When I have a goal I make special efforts to achieve it
label_de: Wenn ich ein Ziel habe, strenge ich mich sehr an, um es zu erreichen

name: spa19
label: I always wear a helmet when riding the bicycle
label_de: Ich trage beim Fahrradfahren immer einen Helm

name: spa20
label: I often cross the street despite red traffic lights
label_de: Ich gehe oft bei Rot über die Ampel

name: tag1
label: I often dream how it would be like to win a large amount of money in the lottery

name: tag2

label_de: In Tagträumen male ich mir häufig eine positive Zukunft aus.

name: tag3
label: In order to get along in life, it is good to have luck on your side
label_de: Um voranzukommen im Leben, braucht man sehr viel Glück.

name: tag4
label: Life is mostly controlled by fate
label_de: Das Leben wird größtenteils vom Schicksal bestimmt.

name: tag5
label: I think my daily job is much more interesting than those of others
label_de: Ich glaube, mein Alltag oder mein Beruf sind weit interessanter als bei v

name: tag6

label_de: Ich bin oft gelangweilt von meinem Alltag.

name: tag7

label_de: Man muss lernen diszipliniert zu sein, wenn man es zu etwas bringen will.

name: tag8

label_de: Ich arbeite für mein Geld und will nichts geschenkt bekommen.

label_de: Wie oft haben Sie Schwierigkeiten, die letzten Details eines Projekts abzuschlie

name: iabm2

label_de: Wie oft haben Sie Schwierigkeiten, einzelne Teilschritte zu planen, wenn Sie ein

name: iabm3
label: How often do you have problems remembering appointments or obligations?
label_de: Wie oft haben Sie Schwierigkeiten, sich an Verabredungen oder Verpflichtungen zu

name: iabm4
label: When a task requires a lot of thought, how often do you avoid / delay getting started?
label_de: Wie oft vermeiden/verzögern sie, mit einer Aufgabe anzufangen, die viel Nachd.

name: iabm5
label: How often do you fidget / squirm with hands / feet when you have to sit for a long time?
label_de: Wie oft winden Sie sich oder zappeln mit den Händen und Füßen, wenn

label_de: Wie oft fühlen Sie sich übermäßig aktiv & wie durch einen Motor angebtrieben

name: iabaut1
label: I often notice small sounds when others do not
label_de: Ich höre oft leise Geräusche, die andere nicht hören.

name: iabaut2
label: I usually concentrate more on the whole picture, rather than the small details
label_de: Normalerweise konzentriere ich mich mehr auf das Gesamtbild als auf Details.

name: iabaut3
label: I find it easy to do more than one thing at once
label_de: Mir fällt es leicht, mehrere Sachen gleichzeitig zu machen.

name: iabaut4
label: If there is an interruption, I can switch back to what I was doing very quickly
label_de: Wenn ich unterbrochen worden bin, kann ich schnell mit vorheriger Tätigkeit w.

name: iabaut5
label: I find it easy to ‘read between the lines’ when someone is talking to me
label_de: Fällt mir leicht, Zwischentöne zu verstehen, wenn sich jem. mit mir unterhält

name: iabaut6
label: I know how to tell if someone listening to me is getting bored
label_de: Wenn ich mit jemandem rede, merke ich, wenn es ihm/ihr langweilig wird.

name: iabaut7
label: When reading a story I find it difficult to work out the characters‘ intentions
label_de: Wenn ich Gesch. lese, fällt es mir schwer, mir Absichten d. Figuren auszumalen

name: iabaut8
label: I like to collect inform. about categories of things (e.g. types of car, birds)
label_de: Ich sammele gerne Informationen zu Kategorien einer Sache, z.B. zu Vogelarten

name: iabaut9
label: I find it easy to work out what someone is thinking/feeling by looking at face
label_de: Mir fällt es leicht herauszufinden, was jemand denkt, wenn ich nur

name: iabaut10
label: I find it difficult to work out people’s intentions
label_de: Mir fällt es schwer zu erkennen, was andere Menschen vorhaben.

name: chaos1

label_de: Wir haben zu Hause eine regelmäßige Routine um den Tag zu beginnen.

name: chaos2

label_de: Bei uns zu Hause ist es oft so laut, dass man sich nicht konzentrieren kann.

label_de: Bei uns zu Hause geht es drunter und drüber.

name: persent1
label: The kind of person someone is cannot be changed significantly
label_de: was für ein Mensch man ist, ist Grundleg., kann nicht maßgebl. verändert werd.

name: persent2
label: You can behave differently, but who you are can‘t be changed significantly
label_de: man kann sich anders verhalt., aber wer man ist kann nicht wirkl. veränd. werd.

name: persent3
label: Everyone is a certain type of person and you cannot do much about changing it
label_de: man ist ein bestimmt. Typ Mensch, gibt nicht viele Mögl., um das zu ändern

name: ieverh5
label: I have occasionally kept the money when given too much change
label_de: ...ich habe schon mal zu viel Wechselgeld zurückbekommen und nichts gesagt

name: ieverh7
label: Sometimes I lie in a pinch
label_de: ...zur Not lüge ich auch schon mal

name: ieverh8
label: I never take things which do not belong to me
label_de: ...ich nehme niemals Dinge an mich, die mir nicht gehören

name: biss1
label: I often set a goal but later choose to pursue a different one
label_de: ...setze mir oft ein Ziel, entscheide mich aber später, ein anderes zu verfolge

name: biss2
label: New ideas and projects sometimes distract me from previous ones
label_de: ...neue Ideen und Projekte halten mich manchmal von vorherigen ab.

name: biss3
label: Have been obsessed with an idea / project for short time but later lost interest
label_de: ...war mal kurze Zeit von Projekt / Idee besessen, verlor später aber Interesse

name: biss4
label: Difficulty maintaining focus on projects taking more than few months to complete
label_de: ...Schwierigkeiten auf Projekte fokussiert zu bleiben, wenn sie Monate dauern

name: biss5
label: I finish whatever I begin
label_de: ...alles was ich beginne, bringe ich auch zu Ende.

name: biss6
label: Setbacks don’t discourage me
label_de: ...von Rückschlägen lasse ich mich nicht entmutigen.

name: hochsta1
label: Afraid people important to me may find out that I’m not as capable as they think
label_de: Angst, dass mir wichtige Pers. herausfinden, dass ich nicht so fähig bin wie si

name: hochsta2
label: Hard for me to accept compliments/praise for my intelligence/accomplishments
label_de: fällt schwer, Komplimente / Lob wegen meiner Intelligenz / Leistungen entgegenz

name: hochsta3
label: Sometimes I’m afraid others will discover how much knowledge/ability I lack
label_de: manchmal Angst, dass die anderen merken, wie wenig ich eigentlich weiß und kann

name: hochsta4
label: Often compare my ability to those around me, think they may be more intelligent
label_de: vergleiche Fähigk. mit Pers. um mich & stelle fest, dass sie vermutl. intellige

name: hochsta5
label: I often worry about not succeeding, even though others have confidence that I will
label_de: oft Sorgen, dass Vorhaben nicht gelingt, trotz Vertrauen Anderer in mein Können

name: ausgr3
label: Others treat me like I wasn‘t there
label_de: ...andere behandeln mich so, als ob ich gar nicht da wäre

name: ausgr4

label_de: ...andere laden mich nicht zu Unternehmungen ein

name: ra011
label: If something upsets me at work, I can quickly get my anger under control

label: I approach difficult tasks at work by considering different courses of action
label_de: Schwierige Arbeitsaufgaben gehe ich an, indem ich verschieden. Handlungsmöglich

label: I can prevent my thoughts from repeatedly digressing from difficult tasks
label_de: Kann verhindern, dass meine Gedanken ständig von schwierigen Aufgaben abschweif

name: ra015
label: If I get too excited at work, I can reassure myself which enables me to carry on

name: ra016
label: Generally, I look at problems at work from multiple perspectives
label_de: I.a.R. betrachte ich problemat. Situat. am Arbeitsplatz aus mehreren Perspektiv.

name: ra017

name: ra018

label_de: Bei schwierig. Arbeitsaufgaben behalte Ziel im Auge, lasse mich nicht abbringen

name: fb0102
label: In Germany, wild foxes can infect people with canine madness
label_de: In Deutschland besteht Risiko, sich an wilden Füchsen mit Tollwut zu infizieren

name: fb0103
label: Foxes socially flexible animals which can live in couples as well as in groups
label_de: Füchse sozial flexible Tiere, die sowohl in Paaren als auch in Gruppen leben

name: fb0104
label: Wild foxes can become relatively old and live up to 20 years
label_de: Wilde Füchse können mit bis zu 20 Jahren relativ alt werden

name: fb0105
label: In Germany, infections of the fox tapeworm are extremely rare
label_de: Infektionen mit dem Fuchsbandwurm sind in Deutschland extrem selten

name: fb0106
label: In Germany, every year half a million foxes are shot
label_de: Jedes Jahr werden in Deutschland über eine halbe Million Füchse geschossen

name: fb0107
label: Foxes in urban envir. don‘t dare to approach humans as much as foxes from outside
label_de: Füchse in Städten wagen sich weniger nah an Menschen heran als -Landfüchse'

name: fb0108
label: Both female and male foxes care about breeding and rearing
label_de: Bei Füchsen beteiligen sich beide Eltern an der Jungenaufzucht

name: fb0109
label: In Germany, every year ~5 to 10 people infect. with morbus metum spread by foxes
label_de: In Deutschland infizieren jhrl. 5-10 Pers. an von Fuchs übertrag. morbus metum

name: fb0111
label: On average, a fox weighs approximately half the weight of a shepherd dog
label_de: Ein Fuchs wiegt durchschnittlich etwa halb so viel wie ein Schäferhund

name: fc011
label: I would be glad about a fox in my garden / close to my home
label_de: Über Fuchs in meinem Garten / in Nähe meines Wohnortes würde ich mich freuen

name: fc013
label: I feel great joy observing foxes
label_de: Es macht mir große Freude, Füchse zu beobachten

name: fc014
label: Foxes belong to nature & environment of humans, should be allowed to live there
label_de: Füchse gehören zu Natur und Umfeld des Menschen und sollen dort leben dürfen

name: fc015
label: I consider foxes as disturbing when they are close to settlements
label_de: Füchse in der Nähe von Siedlungen empfinde ich als störend

name: fc016
label: Foxes potential carriers of disease, do not belong within close range of humans
label_de: Füchse potentielle Krankheitsüberträger, haben nahe zu Mensch nichts verloren

name: fc025
label: Foxes infection risk: Aphthous fever
label_de: Infektionsrisiko durch Füchse: Maul- und Klauenseuche

name: fc041
label: Feelings fox encounter: Fascinated
label_de: Gefühle bei Begegnung mit Fuchs: Fasziniert

name: fc042
label: Feelings fox encounter: Curious
label_de: Gefühle bei Begegnung mit Fuchs: Neugierig

name: fc043
label: Feelings fox encounter: Pleased

label: Feelings fox encounter: Threatened
label_de: Gefühle bei Begegnung mit Fuchs: Bedroht

name: fc045
label: Feelings fox encounter: Harassed
label_de: Gefühle bei Begegnung mit Fuchs: Belästigt

name: fc046
label: Feelings fox encounter: Disturbed
label_de: Gefühle bei Begegnung mit Fuchs: Gestört

name: fc047
label: Feelings fox encounter: Indifferent
label_de: Gefühle bei Begegnung mit Fuchs: Gleichgültig

name: fc051
label: Foxes are a part of our native species and should receive protection & support
label_de: Man sollte Füchse als Teil unserer heimischen Arten fördern und schützen

name: fc052
label: We should not intervene in the fox population. Instead, should behave neutrally
label_de: Man sollte in den Bestand der Füchse nicht eingreifen & sich neutral verhalten

name: fc053

label_de: Füchse in Deutschland sollten flächendeckend gejagt werden

name: im_ivd
label: Innovative Module: INCOM Social Comparison Scale and Social Distance Elicitation
label_de: Innovative Module: INCOM Social Comparison Scale and Social Distance Elicitation

name: ivd01_1
label: Generally, I‘m an honest person
label_de: Im Grunde genommen bin ich eine ehrliche Person

name: ivd02_1
label: Believe that people fully will. to take risks or try to avoid tak. risks
label_de: Glauben Sie, dass andere Menschen gerne Risiken eingehen oder eher vermeiden?

name: ivd02_2
label: People are willing to give to good causes without expecting anything in return
label_de: Menschen dazu bereit, etwas für guten Zweck zu leisten o. Gegenleistung zu erw.

name: ivd02_3
label: People are basically honest
label_de: Im Grunde genommen sind Menschen ehrlich

name: ivd02_4
label: Generally speaking, how satisfied do other people feel with life?
label_de: Ganz allgemein gesprochen, wie zufrieden sind andere Menschen mit ihrem Leben?

name: ivd03_1
label: I often compare how my loved ones are doing relative to how others are doing
label_de: Ich vergleiche häufig das Wohlergehen meiner Angehörigen mit dem von anderen

name: ivd03_2
label: I always pay attention to how I do things compared with how others do things.
label_de: Ich achte immer sehr stark darauf, wie ich Dinge im Vergleich zu anderen mache

name: ivd03_3
label: To find out how well I have done sth, I compare with how others have done it
label_de: Wenn ich herausfinden möchte, wie gut ich etwas erledigt oder gemacht habe, dann

name: ivd03_4
label: I often compare how I am doing socially with other people
label_de: Ich vergleiche häufig meine sozialen Fähigkeiten und meine Beliebtheit mit denen

name: ivd03_5
label: I am not the type of person who often compares him-/herself with others
label_de: Ich bin nicht der Typ Mensch, der sich oft mit anderen vergleicht

name: ivd03_6
label: I often compare myself with others with respect to what I have accomplished
label_de: Ich vergleiche mich häufig selbst mit anderen in Bezug auf das, was ich im Leben

name: ivd03_7
label: I often like to talk with others about mutual opinions and experiences
label_de: Ich tausche mich gerne häufig mit anderen über Meinungen und Erfahrungen aus

name: ivd03_8
label: I often try to find out what others think who face similar problems as I face
label_de: Ich versuche häufig herauszufinden, was andere denken, die mit ähnlichen Problem

name: ivd03_9
label: I always like to know what others in a similar situation would do
label_de: Ich möchte immer gerne wissen, wie sich andere in einer ähnlichen Situation verh

name: ivd03_10
label: When I want to learn more about sth, I try to find out what others think or know
label_de: Wenn ich über etwas mehr erfahren möchte, versuche ich herauszufinden was andere

name: ivd03_11
label: I never consider my situation in life relative to that of other people
label_de: Ich bewerte meine Lebenssituation niemals im Vergleich zu der anderer Personen

name: ptad20_1
label: Reaction to experience of discrimination: I have spoken to the person or place from whom the discrimination originated.
label_de: Reaktion auf Diskriminierungserfahrung: Ich habe die Person oder die Stelle, von der die Diskriminierung ausging, darauf angesprochen.

name: ptad20_2
label: Reaction to experience of discrimination: I have sought advice on my legal options.
label_de: Reaktion auf Diskriminierungserfahrung: Ich habe mich zu meinen rechtlichen Möglichkeiten beraten lassen.

name: ptad20_3
label: Reaction to experience of discrimination: I have independently searched for information on my legal options (e.g. on the Internet, in legal texts).
label_de: Reaktion auf Diskriminierungserfahrung: Ich habe eigenständig nach Informationen zu meinen rechtlichen Möglichkeiten gesucht, (z.B. im Internet, in Gesetzestexten).

name: ptad20_4
label: Reaction to experience of discrimination: I have filed an official complaint (e.g., with employer, school administration).
label_de: Reaktion auf Diskriminierungserfahrung: Ich habe eine offizielle Beschwerde eingereicht (z.B. beim Arbeitgeber, der Schulleitung).

name: ptad20_5
label: Reaction to experience of discrimination: I have taken legal action (e.g., filed a complaint).
label_de: Reaktion auf Diskriminierungserfahrung: Ich habe rechtliche Schritte eingeleitet (z.B. Klage eingereicht).

name: ptad20_6
label: Reaction to experience of discrimination: Other

name: ptad20_7
label: Reaction to experience of discrimination: I have not taken any action.
label_de: Reaktion auf Diskriminierungserfahrung: Ich habe nichts unternommen.

name: ptad20_ka
label: Reaction to experience of discrimination: Not specified

name: ptad21_1
label: No action taken because: I was afraid of negative consequences.
label_de: Nichts unternommen, weil: Ich hatte Angst vor negativen Folgen.

name: ptad21_2
label: No action taken because: I thought it wouldn't do any good.
label_de: Nichts unternommen, weil: Ich dachte, dass es nichts bringen würde.

name: ptad21_3
label: No action taken because: I didn't know who to turn to.
label_de: Nichts unternommen, weil: Ich wusste nicht, an wen ich mich wenden sollte.

name: ptad21_4
label: No action taken because: I didn't have the time or money to do it.
label_de: Nichts unternommen, weil: Mir fehlte es an Zeit oder Geld dazu.

name: ptad21_5
label: No action taken because: I found it burdensome to have to deal with it further.
label_de: Nichts unternommen, weil: Ich fand es belastend, mich weiter damit auseinandersetzen zu müssen.

name: ptad21_6
label: No action taken because: I did not see the need to act.
label_de: Nichts unternommen, weil: Ich habe keine Notwendigkeit gesehen zu handeln.

name: ptad21_ka
label: No action taken because: Not specified

label_de: Versuche, die Gefühle anderer zu respektieren

name: icm12

label_de: Bin glücklich, wenn ich ich anderen helfen kann, auch ohne Gegenleistung

label_de: Fühle mich gut, wenn ich mit anderen zusammenarbeite

name: igsl01_1
label: Attitude: The state must provide financial support for people in difficult circumstances.
label_de: Einstellung: Der Staat muss Menschen in schwierigen Lebenslagen finanziell unterstützen

name: igsl01_2
label: Attitude: Only those who are in need through no fault of their own should receive basic security benefits.
label_de: Einstellung: Grundsicherungsleistungen sollten nur diejenigen bekommen, die unveschuldet in Not geraten sind.

name: igsl01_3
label: Attitude: Basic security benefits are a major financial burden on society.
label_de: Einstellung: Grundsicherungsleistungen sind eine große finanzielle Belastung für die Gesellschaft.

name: igsl01_4
label: Attitude: The offices responsible for basic security benefits treat all people equally.
label_de: Einstellung: Die Ämter, die für Grundsicherungsleistungen zuständig sind, behandeln alle Menschen gleich.

name: igsl01_5
label: Attitude: Many people do not make an effort to get out of basic security benefits.
label_de: Einstellung: Viele Menschen bemühen sich nicht, aus der Grundsicherung wieder herauskommen.

name: igsl01_6
label: Attitude: Everyone should take care of themselves instead of claiming basic security benefits.
label_de: Einstellung: Jeder sollte für sich selbst sorgen statt Grundsicherungsleistungen in Anspruch zu nehmen.

name: igsl01_7
label: Attitude: It is comforting to know that people will be taken care of if they cannot do it themselves.
label_de: Einstellung: Es ist beruhigend zu wissen, dass Menschen versorgt werden, wenn sie es selbst nicht können.

name: igsl03
label: Applicable to the basic security benefit

name: igsl04
label: Applicable if entitled to basic security benefit

name: igsl05_1
label: Reasons against: Information effort higher than performance
label_de: Gründe dagegen: Informationsaufwand höher als Leistung

name: igsl05_2
label: Reasons against: Application not worthwhile if situation changes soon
label_de: Gründe dagegen: Antrag lohnt sich nicht, wenn sich die Situation bald ändert

name: igsl05_3
label: Reasons against: have difficulties with applications or forms
label_de: Gründe dagegen: habe Schwierigkeiten mit Anträgen oder Formularen

name: igsl05_4
label: Reasons against: Feeling of paternalism due to control of the office
label_de: Gründe dagegen: Gefühl der Bevormundung durch Kontrolle des Amtes

name: igsl05_5
label: Reasons against: I am embarrassed to receive basic security benefits
label_de: Gründe dagegen: Bezug von Grundsicherungsleistungen ist mir peinlich

name: igsl05_6
label: Reasons against: do not want to be seen by friends and family as a recipient of basic security benefits
label_de: Gründe dagegen: möchte vor Freunde und Familie nicht als Grundsicherungsbezieher

name: igsl05_7
label: Reasons against: do not want relatives to have to disclose their income
label_de: Gründe dagegen: möchte nicht, dass Angehörige ihr Einkommen offenlegen müssen

name: igsl05_8
label: Reasons against: Fear of having to move
label_de: Gründe dagegen: Angst, umziehen zu müssen

name: igsl05_9
label: Reasons against: little respect as a basic income recipient
label_de: Gründe dagegen: wenig Respekt als Grundsicherungsbezieher

name: igsl05_10
label: Reasons against: do not want to disclose living conditions to authorities
label_de: Gründe dagegen: möchte bei Behörde nicht Lebensumstände offenlegen

name: igsl05_11
label: Reasons against: can get by without basic security benefits
label_de: Gründe dagegen: komme auch ohne Grundsicherungsleistung aus

name: igsl05_12
label: Reasons against: financial support from family or friends
label_de: Gründe dagegen: finanzielle Unterstützung durch Familie oder Freunde

name: igsl05_13
label: Reasons against: Achievements from previous life are not appreciated
label_de: Gründe dagegen: Leistungen aus bisherigen Leben werden nicht gewürdigt

name: isinn01

label_de: Lebe von einem Tag zum nächsten und denke nicht oft über Zukunft nach

label_de: Weiß genau, was ich im Leben erreichen möchte

label_de: Habe das Gefühl, alles getan zu haben, was es im Leben zu tun gibt

name: ptsu_sleiter
label: Which rung of the ladder corresponds to your own current position in society?
label_de: Welche Sprosse der Leiter entspricht eigener gegenwärtiger Position in der Gesellschaft

name: ptsu_sleiterp
label: Which rung of the ladder corresponds to the current position of the partner?
label_de: Welche Sprosse der Leiter entspricht gegenwärtiger Position des Partners/der Partnerin

name: ptsu_sleiterz
label: Goal: Rung of the ladder in 10 years
label_de: Ziel: Sprosse der Leiter in 10 Jahren

name: ptsu_sozauf
label: It depends on myself whether I manage to climb the social ladder.
label_de: Es hängt von mir selber ab, ob ich es schaffe, auf der sozialen Leiter aufzusteigen.

name: ptsu_sozsta1
label: The state should be responsible for ensuring an adequate standard of living for the poor and socially needy?
label_de: Der Staat sollte dafür verantwortlich sein, einen angemessenen Lebensstandard für Arme und sozial Bedürftige sicherzustellen?

name: ptsu_sozsta2
label: The state should be responsible for providing and financing comprehensive education and training opportunities?
label_de: Der Staat sollte dafür verantwortlich sein, umfassende Bildungsund Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten bereitzustellen und zu finanzieren?

name: ptsu_sozsta3
label: The state should be responsible for protecting the health of the population?
label_de: Der Staat sollte dafür verantwortlich sein, die Gesundheit der Bevölkerung zu schützen?

name: ptsu_sozsta4
label: The state should be responsible for ensuring an adequate supply of housing?
label_de: Der Staat sollte dafür verantwortlich sein, eine ausreichende Versorgung mit Wohnraum zu garantieren?

name: ptsu_sozsta5
label: The state should be responsible for reducing income inequalities between rich and poor through taxes and social policies?
label_de: Der Staat sollte dafür verantwortlich sein, Einkommensungleichheiten zwischen Arm und Reich durch Steuern und Sozialpolitik zu verringern?

name: ptsu_sozsta6
label: The state should be responsible for ensuring opportunities for younger generations to advance in society?
label_de: Der Staat sollte dafür verantwortlich sein, die Chancen jüngerer Generationen auf gesellschaftlichen Aufstieg zu gewährleisten?

name: ptsu_sozsta7
label: The state should be responsible for curbing undeclared work as well as tax evasion through more effective controls?
label_de: Der Staat sollte dafür verantwortlich sein, Schwarzarbeit sowie Steuerhinterziehung durch wirksamere Kontrollen einzudämmen?

name: ptsu_sozinv1
label: State and government should invest more in education to improve equity of opportunity
label_de: Staat und Regierung sollten mehr in Bildung zur Verbesserung der Chancengerechtigkeit investieren

name: ptsu_sozinv2
label: Pay for health care and nursing staff should be increased significantly, even if it means significantly higher taxes for all
label_de: Bezahlung von Kranken- und Pflegepersonal sollte deutlich erhöht werden, auch wenn deutlich höhere Steuern für alle

name: ptsu_sozinv3
label: State and government should provide extensive support measures for large businesses and corporations to deal with economic crises, even if it means significantly higher taxes for all?
label_de: Staat und Regierung sollten umfangreiche Unterstützungsmaßnahmen für große Unternehmen und Konzerne zur Bewältigung von Wirtschaftskrisen zur Verfügung stellen, auch wenn das deutlich höhere Steuern für alle bedeuten würde?

name: ptsu_algkuerz1
label: Reduction of financial support for the long-term unemployed if they do not continue their education while unemployed in a measure recognized by the job center.
label_de: Kürzung finanzieller Unterstützung von Langzeitarbeitslosen, wenn sie sich während der Arbeitslosigkeit nicht in einer vom Jobcenter anerkannten Maßnahme weiterqualifizieren.

name: ptsu_algkuerz2
label: Reduction of financial support for the long-term unemployed if they are not prepared to take up any job offered by the office.
label_de: Kürzung finanzieller Unterstützung von Langzeitarbeitslosen, wenn sie nicht bereit sind, jede vom Amt angebotene Stelle anzutreten.

name: ptsu_algkuerz3
label: Reduction of financial support for the long-term unemployed if they have their own assets from which they can support themselves.
label_de: Kürzung finanzieller Unterstützung von Langzeitarbeitslosen, wenn sie eigenes Vermögen besitzen, von dem sie den Lebensunterhalt bestreiten können.

name: ptsu_algkuerz4
label: Reduction of financial support for the long-term unemployed if they refuse to perform community service tasks assigned to them by the state while they are unemployed.
label_de: Kürzung finanzieller Unterstützung von Langzeitarbeitslosen, wenn sie sich während der Arbeitslosigkeit weigern, gemeinnützige Aufgaben zu übernehmen, die ihnen der Staat zuteilt.

name: ptsu_wertsch1
label: I feel that what I do is not appreciated by others
label_de: Ich habe das Gefühl, dass das, was ich tue, von anderen nicht gewürdigt wird

name: ptsu_wertsch2
label: I feel that others look down on me
label_de: Ich habe das Gefühl, dass andere auf mich herabsehen

name: ptsu_wertsch3
label: I feel that others appreciate what I do
label_de: Ich habe das Gefühl, dass andere wertschätzen, was ich tue

name: ptsu_wertsch4
label: I feel that others look up to me
label_de: Ich habe das Gefühl, dass andere zu mir aufschauen

name: pts_polint1

label_de: Wie oft oder selten erscheint Ihnen Politik so kompliziert, dass Sie gar nicht r

label_de: Wie schwer oder leicht fällt es Ihnen, sich über politische Themen eine Meinung

label_de: Wie sehr fühlen Sie sich als Deutsche / Deutscher?

label_de: Wie sehr fühlen Sie sich als Europäer / Europäerin?

name: pts_zuggef_02
label: It is unpleasant for me to belong to the people in Germany
label_de: Es ist mir unangenehm zu den Menschen in Deutschland zu gehören

name: pts_zuggef_03

label_de: Es ist mir wichtig zu den Menschen in Deutschland zu gehören

label: I feel very comfortable when I am with people from Germany
label_de: Ich fühle mich sehr wohl, wenn ich mit Menschen aus Deutschland zusammen bin

name: pts_zuggef_05
label: I feel part of the German society
label_de: Ich fühle mich als Teil der deutschen Gesellschaft

name: pts_zuggef_07
label: The city or region I grew up in is important to me.
label_de: Mir ist die Stadt beziehungsweise die Region in der ich aufgewachsen bin wichtig

name: pts_zuggef_08
label: I am proud of the city or region I grew up in
label_de: Ich bin Stolz auf die Stadt beziehungsweise die Region in der ich aufgewachsen b

name: pts_zuggef_09

label_de: Ich bin stolz auf das Land in dem ich aufgewachsen bin

label_de: Ich fühle mich den Personen meiner ethnischen Gruppe verbunden

name: pts_zuggef_11

label_de: Ich fühle mich den Personen, die in meiner Stadt leben, verbunden

name: pts_zuggef_12

label_de: Ich fühle mich Personen aus meiner Religionsgruppe verbunden

name: muell
label: Do you separate your garbage?
label_de: Trennen Sie Ihren Müll, etwa nach Plastik oder Papier?

name: muelj1
label: Because my contribution to garbage separation counts.
label_de: Weil auch mein eigener Beitrag zur Mülltrennung zählt.

name: muelj2
label: Because one should separate the garbage.
label_de: Weil man seinen Müll trennen sollte.

name: muelj3
label: Because I would have a bad conscience if I did not separate my garbage.
label_de: Weil ich ein schlechtes Gewissen hätte, wenn ich Müll nicht trennen würde

name: muelj4
label: Because I want to set a good example.
label_de: Weil ich als gutes Beispiel vorangehen möchte.

name: muelj5
label: Because separating garbage helps keeping the household tidy.
label_de: Weil das Trennen von Müll für Ordnung im Haushalt sorgt.

name: muelj6
label: Because people in my neighbourhood separate their garbage.
label_de: Weil die Menschen in meiner Nachbarschaft auch ihren Müll trennen.

name: muelj7
label: Because garbage collection is more expensive if I do not separate.
label_de: Weil die Müllabholung teurer wird, wenn ich den Müll nicht trenne.

name: mueln1
label: Because it makes no difference if I separate or not.
label_de: Weil es keinen Unterschied macht, ob ich meinen Müll trenne oder nicht.

name: mueln2
label: Because there is no reason to separate one‘s garbage.
label_de: Weil es keinen Grund gibt, seinen Müll zu trennen.

name: mueln3
label: Because I do not care whether my garbage is separated.
label_de: Weil es mir egal ist, ob mein Müll getrennt wird oder nicht.

name: mueln4
label: Because the costs of garbage separation outrun the advantages.
label_de: Weil die Kosten des Trennens von Müll höher als die Vorteile sind.

name: mueln5
label: Because garbage separation is too time-consuming.

name: mueln6
label: Because people in my neighbourhood do not separate their garbage either.
label_de: Weil die Menschen in meiner Nachbarschaft ihren Müll auch nicht trennen.

name: mueln7
label: Because garbage collection is not more expensive if I do not separate.
label_de: Weil Müllabholung auch nicht wesentl. teurer wird, wenn ich Müll nicht trenne

label_de: Anteil der Personen die ihren Müll weiterhin trennen müssten

name: kd_insta_h
description:
Step 1: The variable kd_insta_h is replaced with -2 for the years 2002, 2005 and 2007. 
Step 2: The variable kd_insta_h is replaced with 1 for the years 2002, 2005 and 2007, if kd_insta_v3 is 1 and the variables kd_insta_v4, kd_insta_v6, kd_insta_v7 are not 1. 
Step 3: The variable kd_insta_h is replaced with 2 for the years 2002, 2005 and 2007, if kd_insta_v4 is 1 and the variables kd_insta_v3, kd_insta_v6, kd_insta_v7 are not 1. 
Step 4: The variable kd_insta_h is replaced with 4 for the years 2002, 2005 and 2007, if kd_insta_v6 is 1 and the variables kd_insta_v3, kd_insta_v4, kd_insta_v7 are not 1. 
Step 5: The variable kd_insta_h is replaced with 7 for the years 2002, 2005 and 2007, if kd_insta_v7 is 1 and the variables kd_insta_v3, kd_insta_v4, kd_insta_v6 are not 1.
label: [de] Traeger Einrichtung/Schule [harmonisiert]

name: kd_instb_h
description:
Step 1: The variable kd_instb_h is replaced with -2 for the years 2011, 2013 and 2015. 
Step 2: The variable kd_instb_h is replaced with 1 for the year 2011, if kd_instb_v2 is 1. 
Step 3: The variable kd_instb_h is replaced with 2 for the year 2011, if kd_instb_v3 is 1. 
Step 4: The variable kd_instb_h is replaced with 3 for the year 2011, if kd_instb_v4 is 1. 
Step 5: The variable kd_instb_h is replaced with 4 for the year 2011, if kd_instb_v5 is 1.
label: [de] Traeger der Schule [harmonisiert]

name: kd_instc_h
description:
Step 1: The variable kd_instc_h is replaced with -2 for the year 2011. 
Step 2: The variable kd_instc_h is replaced with 1 for the year 2011, if kd_instc_v2 is 1. 
Step 3: The variable kd_instc_h is replaced with 2 for the year 2011, if kd_instc_v3 is 1. 
Step 4: The variable kd_instc_h is replaced with 6 for the year 2011, if kd_instc_v4 is 1. 
Step 5: The variable kd_instc_h is replaced with 4 for the year 2011, if kd_instc_v5 is 1.
label: [de] Traeger der Kinderbetreuungseinrichtung [harmonisiert]

name: kd_lunch_h
description:
Step 1: The variable kd_lunch_h is replaced by the variable kd_lunch_v1 for the years 2002, 2005 and 2007. 
Step 2: The variable kd_lunch_h is replaced by the variable kd_lunch_v2 for the year 2011.
label: [de] Mittagessen in Betreuungseinrichtung/Kita/Tagesmutter [harmonisiert]

name: kd_time_h
description:
Step 1: The variable kd_time_v1 is recoded (1=2) (2=2) (3=1) for the years 1998 to 2008 and subsequently integrated into the harmonized variable kd_time_h. 
Step 2: The variable kd_time_h is replaced by the variable kd_time_v2 for the years 2009 to 2011 and 2022 to 2023.
label: [de] Schulbesuch - ganztags [harmonisiert]

name: kk_amtp_h
description: Step 1: The variable kk_amtp_h is replaced by the variable kk_amtp_v1 for the years 2002, 2005 and 2007.
label: [de] Betreuungseinrichtungskosten (Euro) [harmonisiert]

name: ks_gen_h
description: Step 1: The variable ks_gen_h is replaced by the variable ks_gen_v4 for the years 1998 to 2011 and 2022 to 2023.
label: [de] Allgemeine Schule [harmonisiert]

name: ks_none_h
description: Step 1: The variable ks_none_v1 is recoded (1=5) for the years 1998 to 2008 and subsequently integrated into the harmonized variable ks_none_h.
label: [de] Schulbesuch [harmonisiert]

name: k_rel_h
description:
Step 1: The variable k_rel_v1 is recoded (0=0) (1=11) (2=13) (3=20) (4=24) (5=27) (6=30) (7=35) (8=40) (9=25) (10=60) (11=70) (12=22) (13=12) (99=-1) for the years 1998 to 2011 and subsequently integrated into the harmonized variable k_rel_h. 
Step 2: The variable k_rel_h is replaced by the variable k_rel_v2 for the years 2012 to 2020.
label: [de] Stellung des Kindes zum HV [harmonisiert]

name: kc_care_h
description:
Step 1: The variable kc_care_h is replaced with -2 for the years 1999 to 2002, 2004 to 2020 and 2022 to 2023. 
Step 2: The variable kc_care_h is replaced with 1 for the years 1999 to 2002, 2004 to 2011 and 2022 to 2023, if kc_care_v2 is 1 and the variables kc_care_v3, kc_care_v4,kc_care_v5 are not 1. 
Step 3: The variable kc_care_h is replaced with 2 for the years 1999 to 2002, 2004 to 2011 and 2022 to 2023, if kc_care_v3 is 1 and the variables kc_care_v2, kc_care_v4,kc_care_v5 are not 1. 
Step 4: The variable kc_care_h is replaced with 3 for the years 1999 to 2002, 2004 to 2011 and 2022 to 2023, if kc_care_v4 is 1 and the variables kc_care_v2, kc_care_v3,kc_care_v5 are not 1. 
Step 5: The variable kc_care_h is replaced with 4 for the years 1999 to 2002, 2004 to 2011 and 2022 to 2023, if kc_care_v5 is 1 and the variables kc_care_v2, kc_care_v3,kc_care_v4 are not 1. 
Step 6: The variable kc_care_h is replaced with 5 for the years 1999 to 2002, 2004 to 2020 and 2022 to 2023, if kc_care_h does not apply to the person asked and the variables kc_care_v2,kc_care_v3,kc_care_v4,kc_care_v5 are 1.
label: [de] Kinderbetreuung durch andere Personen [harmonisiert]

Step 3: The variable stell_v3 is recoded (1=11) (2=13) (3=20) (4=30) (5=40) (6=64) (7=70) for the years 2022 and 2023 and subsequently integrated into the harmonized variable stell_h, if stell_v2 is not included in that version of the questionnaire or stell_v2 is 99.
